intro: Dauceria obtusa, commonly known as the bluntleaf hedge parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a mild, parsley-like scent when crushed. Dauceria obtusa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
